headline: What Exxon Mobil (XOM)'s Shifting Geopolitical and LNG Exposure Means For Shareholders
summary: In recent weeks, Exxon Mobil has been affected by rising oil prices linked to heightened U.S.-Iran tensions, ongoing large-scale developments in Guyana, and new LNG-related contracts in Papua New Guinea that collectively reshape its operating backdrop. These events highlight how Exxon's exposure to geopolitically sensitive supply, long-lived offshore resources, and infrastructure partnerships may influence its longer-term growth mix and risk profile. Next, we will examine how heightened...

headline: Occidental Stock Heads for Best Day in a Year. It’s Not Just About Oil Prices.
summary: Occidental Petroleum stock surged Thursday after the energy giant posted fourth-quarter earnings that topped expectations.  Occidental posted its latest earnings after the bell Wednesday.  ConocoPhillips  gained 1.1% while  Chevron  and  Exxon  were up 0.9% and 0.8%, respectively.

headline: MISC wins contract for Papua New Guinea’s first FSO vessel
summary: The planned FSO unit will have an operational life of 30 years and a minimum storage capacity of 800,000bbl.

headline: Occidental Stock Jumps 10%. It’s Not Just About Oil Prices.
summary: Occidental Petroleum stock surged early Thursday after its fourth-quarter earnings beat expectations.  The oil and gas producer’s shares rose 10% to $51.82 in early trading, after it published earnings late Wednesday.  Its peers were also up early Thursday—as oil prices climbed around 2% due to ongoing tensions between the U.S. and Iran—but by a smaller margin.

raw.headline: Occidental Stock Jumps 10%. It’s Not Just About Oil Prices.

summary: Japan's $36B U.S. investment targets energy, exports and minerals. ETFs like XLE could ride the industrial boost from this landmark pledge.

headline: Occidental Stock Jumps 6%. It’s Not Just About Oil Prices.
summary: Occidental Petroleum stock jumped around 6% ahead of the open Thursday after its fourth-quarter earnings beat expectations.  The oil and gas producer’s shares rose 5.8% to $49.85 in premarket trading, after it published earnings late Wednesday.  Its peers were also up early Thursday—as oil prices climbed around 1.5% due to ongoing tensions between the U.S. and Iran—but by a smaller margin.

headline: After Years of Buybacks, Big Oil is Drilling Again
summary: After years of prioritizing shareholder returns and low-carbon initiatives, major oil companies are shifting back to a growth strategy focused on expanding reserves and production as long-term demand for oil and gas is no longer expected to peak before 2030.

raw.headline: After Years of Buybacks, Big Oil is Drilling Again
raw.summary: After years of prioritizing shareholder returns and low-carbon initiatives, major oil companies are shifting back to a growth strategy focused on expanding reserves and production as long-term demand for oil and gas is no longer expected to peak before 2030.

headline: Guyana Emerges as the Clear Winner in Venezuela’s Oil Reset
summary: Guyana is set to become an even greater oil powerhouse as the easing of tensions with Venezuela following Nicolas Maduro’s exit lowers risk and accelerates development of the massive Stabroek block.

raw.headline: Guyana Emerges as the Clear Winner in Venezuela’s Oil Reset
raw.summary: Guyana is set to become an even greater oil powerhouse as the easing of tensions with Venezuela following Nicolas Maduro’s exit lowers risk and accelerates development of the massive Stabroek block.
